IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: EDUCATION OF LIVESTOCK PRODUCTION, DEVELOPMENT OF YOUTH, AND EDUCATING THE GENERAL PUBLIC.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ASSOCIATION IS AN EDUCATIONAL ORGANIZATION WHOSE PRIMARY PURPOSES INCLUDE (1) LIVESTOCK PRODUCTION EDUCATION (2) EDUCATIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF YOUTH, AND (3) EDUCATING THE GENERAL PUBLIC. SEE "SCHEDULE O" FOR A FULL DESCRIPTION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION.
IRS990.Desc: PRESENTATION OF THE NATIONAL WESTERN STOCK SHOW, HORSE SHOW ANDRODEO: WSSA ORGANIZATIONAL DOCUMENTS AND APPLICATION FOR TAXEXEMPT STATUS REQUIRE IT TO PRODUCE THE SHOW EACH YEAR. THE SHOWTAKES PLACE AT THE NATIONAL WESTERN COMPLEX IN DENVER, CO EVERYJANUARY, AND FOR THE LAST SEVERAL YEARS HAS BEEN ATTENDED BY OVER600,000 PEOPLE. DETAILED INFORMATION ON THE VARIOUS EDUCATIONALACTIVITIES AND BENEFITS OF THIS ANNUAL EVENT IS FAR TOO EXTENSIVETO BE PRESENTED ON A SUMMARY SCHEDULE IN FORM 990.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: OFF-SEASON EDUCATIONAL SHOWS AND RELATED PROGRAMS: OUTSIDE OF THEMONTH OF JANUARY, THE ASSOCIATION PROMOTES USAGE OF ITS FACILITIESBY A VARIETY OF OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, MANY OF WHICH AREAGRICULTURE, LIVESTOCK OR HORSE ORIENTED ORGANIZATIONS. THESEORGANIZATIONS PRODUCE THEIR OWN SHOWS IN THE NATIONAL WESTERNCOMPLEX BASED ON CONTRACTS WITH THE ASSOCIATION. SUPPORTED BYASSOCIATION PERSONNEL AND OTHER RESOURCES, MANY OF THESE SHOWSPROVIDE EDUCATIONAL BENEFITS TO THE PARTICIPANTS AND THE GENERALPUBLIC ATTENDING SIMILAR TO THOSE DERIVED FROM THE NATIONALWESTERN STOCK SHOW, HORSE SHOW AND RODEO IN JANUARY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: NATIONAL WESTERN SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAMS: WSSA ESTABLISHED THENATIONAL WESTERN SCHOLARSHIP FUND DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDEDMARCH 31, 1985 TO PROVIDE FOR SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS TO STUDENTSINTERESTED IN LIVESTOCK OR AGRICULTURE. THE SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAMHAS GROWN DRAMATICALLY WITH NUMEROUS STUDENTS AND PROSPECTIVESTUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS ANNUALLY BOTH THROUGH WSSAAND THROUGH A SCHOLARSHIP ENDOWMENT FROM WSSA MATCHED BY ANDADMINISTERED BY THE UNIVERSITY OF WYOMING.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: JUNIOR LIVESTOCK AUCTION SUPPORT AND OTHER PROGRAMS: IN ADDITION TO ITS SUPPORT OF JUNIOR EXHIBITORS THROUGH THE PREMIER EXHIBITOR SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM DISCUSSED ABOVE, THE ASSOCIATION PROVIDES OTHER FINANCIAL SUPPORT DIRECTLY AND IN THE FORM OF AWARDS FOR THE JUNIOR LIVESTOCK SHOW AND AUCTION VIA A CARCASS CONTEST AND OTHER ACTIVITIES. THE ASSOCIATION ALSO PROMOTES YOUTH EDUCATION RELATIVE TO AGRICULTURE, LIVESTOCK PRODUCTION AND WHAT CAN BE SEEN AT THE NATIONAL WESTERN STOCK SHOW IN VARIOUS WAYS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ASSOCIATION APPLIES A MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT MEASUREMENT METHODOLOGY TO REFLECT THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IMPACT OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. AFTER EVALUATING THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, NONE ARE CONSIDERED TO BE UNCERTAIN; THEREFORE, NO AMOUNTS HAVE BEEN RECOGNIZED AS OF MARCH 31, 2018 AND 2017. IF INCURRED, INTEREST AND PENALTIES ASSOCIATED WITH THE TAX POSITIONS ARE RECORDED IN THE PERIOD ASSESSED AS GENERAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSE. NO INTEREST OR PENALTIES HAVE BEEN ASSESSED AS OF MARCH 31, 2018 AND 2017.
DIRECT EXPENSES OF OFF-SEASON COMPLEX SHOWS, NON-EXEMPT 2,874,291.
DIRECT EXPENSES OF OFF-SEASON COMPLEX SHOWS, NON-EXEMPT 2,874,291.

FundraisingEventInformationGrp.Event1Nm: COORS WESTERN ART SALE AND EXHIBIT

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: THE WESTERN STOCK SHOW ASSOCIATION SCHOLARSHIP TRUST

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART II, LINE 1, COLUMN H THE WESTERN STOCK SHOW ASSOCIATION SCHOLARSHIP TRUST (H) PURPOSE OF GRANT OR ASSISTANCE: TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE FUNDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS PROVIDED BY THE WESTERN STOCK SHOW ASSOCIATION SCHOLARSHIP TRUST TO PROMOTE THE EDUCATIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF YOUTH INTERESTED IN WORKING IN AGRICULTURE AND LIVESTOCK PRODUCTION VIA PROVIDING SCHOLARSHIPS TO A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF STUDENTS PURSUING A COLLEGE DEGREE IN AN AGRICULTURE RELATED FIELD, AS WELL AS TO A NUMBER OF STUDENTS PURSUING EDUCATION IN THE FIELD OF MEDICINE WHO AGREE TO PRACTICE FOR A TIME IN A RURAL COMMUNITY.
A PORTION OF THE BONUS IS BASED ON IF THE ORGANIZATION AS A WHOLE MEETS BUDGET, INCLUDING THE MEETING OF THE BUDGETED NET EARNINGS AT THE END OF THE YEAR.

THE ASSOCIATION IS AN EDUCATIONAL ORGANIZATION WHOSE PRIMARY PURPOSES INCLUDE (1) IMPROVING AGRICULTURAL AND LIVESTOCK PRODUCTION IN THE WESTERN STATES THROUGH EDUCATION OF FARMERS, RANCHERS AND LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS, (2) PROMOTING THE EDUCATIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF YOUTH INTEREST IN WORKING IN AGRICULTURE AND LIVESTOCK PRODUCTION, AND (3) EDUCATING THE GENERAL PUBLIC AS TO THE AGRICULTURE AND LIVESTOCK PRODUCTION INDUSTRIES. AN AUXILIARY PURPOSE OF THE ASSOCIATION IS TO PRESERVE AND PROMOTE AMERICAN WESTERN CULTURE, VALUES AND THE WESTERN HERITAGE OF THIS PART OF THE COUNTRY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PERSONS INTERESTED IN THE EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES OF THE ASSOCIATION IN THE FIELDS OF LIVESTOCK AND AGRICULTURE WHO DESIRE TO BECOME MEMBERS OF THE ASSOCIATION SHALL SUBMIT TO THE ASSOCIATION LETTERS OF SUPPORT FOR SUCH MEMBERSHIP FROM TWO MEMBERS OF THE ASSOCIATION, ONE OF WHOM IS A TRUSTEE OF THE ASSOCIATION. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS SHALL REVIEW ALL MEMBERSHIP APPLICATIONS AND ACCEPT (OR REJECT) THEM AT ITS NEXT ANNUAL MEETING. UPON ACCEPTANCE OF THE APPLICATION BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AND PAYMENT OF THE CURRENT MEMBERSHIP FEE, THE APPLICANT SHALL BECOME A MEMBER OF THE ASSOCIATION. THE SECRETARY/TREASURER OF THE ASSOCIATION PREPARES AND ISSUES MEMBERSHIP CERTIFICATES IN SUCH FORM AS APPROVED FROM TIME TO TIME BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. EXCEPT FOR SURVIVING SPOUSES WHOSE MEMBERSHIP CARRY NO VOTING RIGHTS, EACH MEMBER SHALL BE ENTITLED TO CAST ONE VOTE ON EACH ISSUE OR NOMINEE UPON WHICH A VOTE IS TAKEN AT ANY MEETING OF THE MEMBERS OF THE ASSOCIATION. A MEMBER ENTITLED TO VOTE MAY VOTE IN PERSON OR MAY VOTE BY PROXY, IN WRITING, EXECUTED BY THE MEMBER OF HIS OR HER DULY AUTHORIZED ATTORNEY IN FACT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WILL BE COMPRISED OF THE CHAIR OF THE TRUSTEES, THE VICE CHAIR, THE SECRETARY/TREASURER AND UP TO TWO ADDITIONAL DIRECTORS ELECTED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE PRESIDENT WILL SERVE EX OFFICIO. THE CHAIR OF THE TRUSTEES SHALL BE THE CHAIR OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. ANY VACANCY IN THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAY BE FILLED BY A RESOLUTION ADOPTED BY A MAJORITY OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THE COMPLETE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO FILING THE TAX RETURN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN ANNUAL QUESTIONNAIRE IS REQUIRED TO BE COMPLETED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AT THE ANNUAL BOARD MEETING TO MONITOR AND ENFORCE COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ASSOCIATION MAINTAINS A PUBLIC DISCLOSURE NOTEBOOK AT ITS ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICES WHICH IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS.
